locutie.beschrijving: The preacher contrasts the 'wishful thinking' of the Apocrypha with the 'pessimism' of Ecclesiastes, finally resolving in the 'promises' of Revelation. It uses literary references (Shakespeare) and personal anecdotes.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: Strong. Distinguishes between canonical and apocryphal perspectives with theological nuance.

illocutie.beschrijving: Primarily asserting the reality of death and the human condition, then shifting to asserting the reliability of God's promises.
voorbeelden: I am going to suggest this morning...
The book of Revelation has taken a bad rap.
It all depends on where Revelation came from.

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: To move the hearer from existential dread/skepticism to a grounded hope in God's future.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Low. The Spirit is not explicitly invoked as the agent of the word's efficacy.

voorbeelden: Essex, Connecticut really is the best small town...
The book of Ecclesiastes is in the canonical Scripture for a very good reason.
Remember that these thrilling words rest...
I thought that was unutterably sad.
I hope that strikes you as powerfully...
God himself will be with them.
He will wipe away every tear.
commissieven.kwaliteit: The preacher quotes God's promises but rarely utters a fresh commissive in the first person on God's behalf.

declaratieven.autoriteit: Low. The preacher acts as an observer of the text rather than a mandatory of the Word.

indicatoren: Literary analysis of Macbeth and Ecclesiastes.
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer is an observer of a lecture on hope rather than a recipient of a promise.

missende_elementen: Direct promise ('I promise you in the name of Christ')

toezegging_check.kwaliteit_toezeggen: Mediated through scripture quotes rather than direct address.
voorbeelden: the God who raised his Son Jesus Christ from the dead is a God who is able to keep his promises.

eerste_persoon.gebruik: Subjective experience and homiletical 'I' (I think, I suggest).

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Addressing the congregation as 'you' in a conversational/teaching mode.

derde_persoon.distantie_effect: High. It treats the Gospel as a topic of discussion.

tijdloos_present.gebruik: General truths about life and death.

foutief_patroon.beschrijving: Assertive (Life is hard) -> Assertive (Revelation says God wins) -> Directive (Remember this).
voorbeelden: Death is real... remember that these thrilling words rest... on the eternal word of God.
foutief_patroon.probleem: It lacks the 'Toezegging' (Commissive) where the preacher binds God to the specific hearer.

voorbeelden_slechte_verhouding: So if this visiting preacher... has anything to say... remember that these thrilling words rest...

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: The sermon functions as a sophisticated literary and theological comparison. It explains the 'why' of hope but does not 'deliver' the hope as a sacramental act.

sterke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: The contrast between Ecclesiastes and Ecclesiasticus.

zwakke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: I have not put my trust in God’s coming kingdom because I have avoided the tough issues.
zwakke_punten.probleem: The preacher talks about her own faith rather than bestowing Christ on the hearer.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: It is an 'event' of learning and reflection, but not a 'sacramental event' of encounter.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: The language remains descriptive (constative) rather than creative (performative).

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: God is the object of the speech, not the subject speaking through the preacher.
openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: The preacher acts as a 'visiting teacher' rather than an ambassador.
tekstueel_bewijs: If this visiting preacher this morning has anything to say at all...

pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: Implicitly relies on the hearer's 'thinking' rather than the Spirit's 'working'.
tekstueel_bewijs: Thinking people of faith will continue to be challenged...

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: No, it is treated as an 'encouragement'.
tekstueel_bewijs: It is full of encouragement, hope, and comfort.

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: The God who raised his Son Jesus Christ from the dead is a God who is able to keep his promises.
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: Because God raised Jesus from the dead, I promise you today: He will not leave you in the dust.
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Shifts from a fact about God to an act of God through the preacher.

toezegging_versterking.probleem: The promise is quoted from Revelation as a general truth.
toezegging_versterking.suggestie: Apply the promise of Revelation 21 directly to the congregation's specific griefs.
voorbeeldzinnen: To you who have lost children, Christ says: I make all things new.

adressering_verbetering.suggestie: Increase 'You' in the context of grace.

indicatief_imperatief_herstel.probleem: The imperative 'remember' is a mental work.
indicatief_imperatief_herstel.suggestie: Make the indicative so strong that the response is 'Alleluia' rather than 'Remember'.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A brilliant intellectual piece that needs to be 'baptized' into performative speech to become a sacramental event.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: SvT would focus on the preacher's 'Self-revealing' (the family photos). SAT reveals that this self-revelation is merely constative and does not perform grace.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: Rhetorically, the Macbeth quote is excellent. In SAT, it is a locutionary ornament that delays the illocutionary act.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT exposes that even a sermon with 'good content' can fail if it never moves from 'talking about God' to 'speaking for God'.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: The canonical Biblical view... is that if we were left to ourselves, our lives would end in emptiness.
kernzinnen_analyse.effectiviteit: High for teaching, low for event.

appendices.notities: The sermon is highly 'locutionary'—it is a beautiful text, but the 'illocutionary' bridge to the hearer is thin.
